text: The Digital Economy Act 2010 is a law passed by the British government. It was introduced to prevent software piracy and to give Ofcom extra power to combat piracy. The law also deals with other things related to technology and television. Some people have said that the act was not examined well enough before it became law and should be changed to be more fair.Open Rights Group's comments ==Related pages== * Software piracy * Computer legislation * United Kingdom == References == Category:2010s Acts of the Parliament of the United Kingdom Category:Software Category:2010 in the United Kingdom
title: Digital Economy Act 2010
